title: The Death Business Is Booming—for Now
sub_head: Providers of funeral services got an unexpected surge when Covid-19 arrived, while life insurers were  inundated with claims
body:
Plenty of businesses saw surging demand during the pandemic and are bracing for a hangover.
So when Thomas Ryan, chief executive officer of the innocuously-named Service Corp. International, said recently that “2021 has exceeded our expectations” but that his company is “expecting Covid to have a negative pull-forward effect on revenue and earnings,” he could have been talking about exercise bikes, furniture or video streaming subscriptions.
